intro: Bunium bulbocastanum var. baldense, commonly known as the Balkan fennel, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its bulbous root is the primary part used, and it has a strong, licorice-like flavor. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
